head.supplied: ¶ Returned with grateful acknowledgement of the arrangements approved of by the hon. the Chief Secretary. ¶ Ferd. Mueller. ¶ 17/10/64...

div.p: J64/10510, unit 34, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria

On 13 October 1864 the Assistant Commissioner of Lands and Survey, C. Hodgkinson, wrote to McCulloch: 'Adverting to the correspondence which has recently taken place get copies of this correspondence ** see below relative to supply from the Botanical Gardens of 500 Californian Pines and Cypresses, and 500 ordinary Pines for planting during 165 in the reserves vested in the Board of Land and Works, I have the honor to state that the proposal of Dr Mueller to furnish during the ensuing year the number and descriptions of trees mentioned in my letter of the 12th ulto (with the substitution of 250 Himalaya Pines for a similar number of Californian Pines) will be quite satisfactory, and the suggested transmission through your Department of all requisitions for supplies from the Botanical Gardens, will, in future, be duly observed. The requisite arrangements and preparation for the reception in the reserves for which they are required, of the promised supplies will be made and proceeded with in the meantime.' The Under Secretary, J. Moore, fowarded Hodgkinson's letter to M for his 'information' on 14 October.
See also C. Hodgkinson to M, 12 September 1864.
Did Hodgkinson complain to the Chief Sec? check the registers for this part of the corresp at the PRO.
Returned with grateful acknowledgement of the arrangements approved of by the hon. the Chief Secretary.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
